resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Recently Hadoop upgraded to use Protobuf 2.5.0. To build the trunk, I updated my installed Protobuf 2.5.0. With this upgrade, I didn't encounter the build failure due to protoc, but failed when building HDFS sub-project. Bellow is failure message. I'm using Mac OS X.

fields.summary: Maven OutOfMemory exception when building with protobuf 2.5.0

comments.body: Moved to Hadoop since it appears to be a general build issue. I can reproduce it when building trunk with '-Pdist -Dtar'. The only workaround is to use protobuf 2.4 and pass -Dprotobuf.version=2.4.1.

sounds unrelated. Try increasing your heap size for maven"
{code}
export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xms256m -Xmx512m -Djava.awt.headless=true"
{code

Hi Arpit, 
In my environment(OS X), I could compile HttpFs correctly with trunk. Before compiling after upgrading your protobuf, please issue mvn clean. If not, the jar binaries which is compiled with protobuf 2.4.1 and 2.5.0 mixes, and it can causes some regression.

SteveL's workaround solved it for me.

Tsuyoshi - 'mvn compile' would work but building a distribution with '-Pdist -Dtar' would fail consistently and only with protobuf 2.5.0.

Thanks!
Resolving, please re-open if Steve's fix is insufficient. FWIW, I have not hit this in my Ubuntu dev environment.
Edited a few fields to make it easier to find in case someone else hits the same issue.

Patched BUILDING.TXT in branch-trunk, 2.1 and 2.1-beta to discuss this issue and provide the example env (I dropped the -headless flag to avoid distractions, though it is useful in OS/X to stop surefire bringing up windows)
